Class CsvSchemaLine

java.lang.Object
  org.jsapar.schema.SchemaLine
      org.jsapar.schema.CsvSchemaLine
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class CsvSchemaLine
extends SchemaLine

Describes the schema how to parse or write a comma separated line.

Author:
stejon0

setCellSeparator

public void setCellSeparator(java.lang.String cellSeparator)
Sets the character sequence that separates each cell. This value overrides setting for the schema.
In output schemas the non-breaking space character ' ' is not allowed since that character is used to replace any occurrence of the separator within each cell.

Parameters:
cellSeparator - the cellSeparator to set

output

public void output(Line line,
                   java.io.Writer writer)
            throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from class: SchemaLine
Writes a line to the writer. Each cell is identified from the schema by the name of the cell. If the schema-cell has no name, the cell at the same position in the line is used under the condition that it also lacks name. If the schema-cell has a name the cell with the same name is used. If no such cell is found and the cell at the same position lacks name, it is used instead. If no corresponding cell is found for a schema-cell, the cell is left empty. Sub-class decides how to treat empty cells.

Specified by:
output in class SchemaLine
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getSchemaCell

public SchemaCell getSchemaCell(java.lang.String cellName)
Description copied from class: SchemaLine
Finds a schema cell with the specified name. This method probably performs a linear search, thus the performance is poor if there are many cells on a line.

Specified by:
getSchemaCell in class SchemaLine
Parameters:
cellName - The name of the schema cell to find.
Returns:
The schema cell with the supplied name or null if no such cell was found.
